page.title: 18Anston Brook Infant School
page.content: Mrs.M.Kelly has been the headmistress 13 years since 1972 when the school opened. The builders started designing the school in 1970 and by 1971 work started. The{Infant school}was originally built because the{Junior {school}was too small and so plans were drawn up for an infant school. The school opened in 1972 and 60 nursery and 140 infant children were taught. In 1985 there are 54 nursery and 137 infants. Children start nursery in the term just before they are 4.The school has six classrooms. There are 25 staff including the head, 6 teachers, a nursery assistant, 2 clerical/non- teaching assistants, dinner ladies, caretaker and cleaners. The school starts at 9.00 and finishes at 3.15. Parents are involved with helping the children in the classroom and also when the classes go on outings.
